alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 20 at 8:29PM MST until March 21 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT TO 2 PM MST TUESDAY ABOVE 6500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 6500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 to 40 mph from late Tuesday morning through the afternoon. Snow is expected to mix with or change to rain below 8000 feet later Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday night, before changing back to snow early Wednesday morning. Watch for additional statements regarding the snow on Wednesday. * WHERE...Areas above 6500 feet near Doney Park, Flagstaff, Grand Canyon, North Rim, and Williams. * WHEN...From midnight MST tonight to 2 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning commute. Snow forecast from midnight Tonight to 2 PM Tuesday: Doney Park 1 to 3 inches Flagstaff 3 to 5 inches Grand Canyon 3 to 5 inches North Rim 6 to 10 inches Williams 3 to 5 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Western Mogollon Rim
